Brown heads to convention with eye on political fallout

Senator Scott Brown will watch Mitt Romney accept the GOP nomination tonight while hoping to minimize any fallout to his own campaign. (Globe, 9:52 a.m.)

Fall sports and concussion prevention

From high-tech football helmets to changes in practice drills, Mass. sports coaches are aiming to reduce head injuries among young athletes as fall seasons begin.
  • Advances in equipment may avert some head injuries
  • Symptoms of concussions | Returning after an injury

Whole Foods has eye on Foodmaster

Whole Foods Market is in talks to buy or take over leases for six Johnnie’s Foodmaster locations in eastern Mass., possibly bringing an end to one of the last urban family grocery chains. (Boston Globe)
  • Discuss What do you think of the potential sale?

Patrick dismisses all 5 transportation board members before state remake

The dismissal is the first step in replacing the panel that oversees Mass. highways and transportation with a larger board structure. (Boston Globe)

Protecting your smartphone's data

Data encryption and location tracking are among the ways users can protect and preserve their smartphone's data in the event of loss or theft. (Boston Globe)

Medicare arguments
key for both parties

Romney is the man to deliver

Republicans have hired Mitt Romney, with his chiseled features and air of competence, to bring what they want: A win on Nov. 6.

Republican Sean Bielat personally pocketed as much as $10,000 by selling access to the donor list from his failed bid to unseat Barney Frank two years ago.

Today, the Home’s Knight Children’s Center on South Huntington Avenue sends the last of its charges to a sparkling new facility in Walpole.

Theo Epstein left the Red Sox last fall but remained the architect of this year’s hugely disappointing Red Sox.
